data.title: Mozypro cloud based server
data.meta_description: Outright automates small business accounting by syncing and organizing all of your accounts. Even better, MozyPro is ISO27001 certified, a best practices rating for measurement of information...
data.text:
Outright automates small business accounting by syncing and organizing all of your accounts. Even better, MozyPro is ISO27001 certified, a best practices rating for measurement of information security management. Designed for SMBs, the service uses military-grade encryption to protect your data. MozyPro is a pay-as-you-go data storage and back up service that mitigates the need to purchase hardware. and Amazon Web Services are vying for domination of the cloudsphere with their full suites of cloud offerings that provide the gamut of applications from sales, database management, customer service and private social networking services. Users pay their PaaS provider for what they use just like a utility, greatly reducing overhead. PaaS, also known as Software as a Service (SaaS), eliminates the need to build expensive on-premise applications. Platform as a Service (PaaS) − and Amazon Web Services Cloudy with a chance of cost savingĭepending on whether you want to make a wholesale move to the cloud or shift a few operations, there are several hot services designed specifically for SMB productivity.

Cloud-based startups are predicted to number in the thousands over the next few years. Harbingers of the future, VCs are insisting their startups stay lean and mean by using cloud services to test and build out business concepts as well as to scale the business.Ĭoncerns about security aren’t putting much of a damper on the party. And the skies are just going to get cloudier. Several services we take for granted such as WordPress, Gmail, Skype and GoToMeeting are cloud-based. Many businesses are already using the cloud and don’t even know it Replacing heavy IT expenditures with predictable operational expenditures Outsourcing the expensive burden of maintaining your own servers and softwareĪccessing data from anywhere and from any device With the onset of the cloud, essential aspects of every business like data management, content, and collaboration tools are delivered from the Internet rather than supported by locally installed software and servers.įor SMBs there are many compelling reasons to migrate to cloud-based applications, like the following: Cloud computing is changing how computer needs are fulfilled. The company has 60,000 business customers globally, 50 petabytes of data collectively.More and more SMBs have their heads in the clouds and for good reason.

EMC then introduced Mozy services to Australia in 2008. Mozy was acquired by EMC Corporation in 2007 when EMC bought the Mozy developers, Berkley Data Systems for $76 million. Telstra’s range of T-Suite applications include Microsoft Exchange Online, Microsoft Business Productivity Online Suite, Mcafee SaaS Endpoint Protection, MessageLabs Email Protection and Xero Online Accounting with most applications available for a free 30 day trial. They are also able to restore data and back-up the SQL Server and Exchange platforms on Windows. Customers can select data to backup, chose when automatic backups occur and access their history log, configurations and bandwidth usage. A 30 day trial for initial sign-ups of the packages is available for T-Suite customers, with charging to begin after the trial.īoth options include use of SAS70-certified and ISO-compliant datacentres, and Telstra said it ensured that data would encrypted at all stages of the process - before transmission, transit and whilst in storage. Two options are available to SMB customers - one with available space from 10GB to 1TB of data, and another with 5GB to 50GB of backup space. “Remote Backup MozyPro Server and PC are all about simple, convenient data backup and retrieval.” “Catastrophic data loss can wipe out years of work – if not your entire business,” said Marcus Bartram, the telco’s head of Cloud Solutions Marketing within its small and medium business division. Telstra announced today that small to medium businesses would have access to EMC’s Mozy Pro remote backup solution through its T-Suite software as a service platform.
